locations.name: The Fractured Realms
locations.description: A world shattered by the Sundering, where fragments of divine power lie scattered across broken continents. Magic flows unpredictably through ley lines that shift with the moons.
locations.climate: Varies wildly by region due to magical instability
locations.history: Once a unified world ruled by the Divine Compact, shattered 500 years ago when the gods withdrew their power.
locations.cultural_significance: The Sundering shapes all cultureÃ¢â‚¬â€religions seek to restore or prevent the gods' return.
locations.visual_references: High fantasy meets post-apocalyptic. Think Lord of the Rings if Mordor won, then lost again.
locations.lighting_notes: Often overcast, dramatic god-rays through cloud breaks
locations.sound_notes: Distant thunder, wind through ruins, occasional magical hum

locations.name: The Central Kingdoms
locations.description: The most stable landmass, home to the human-dominated kingdoms that emerged after the Sundering. Rolling hills, ancient forests, and fertile valleys dotted with castle-cities.
locations.history: United under the Valen dynasty 300 years ago, now fracturing as the current king weakens.
locations.cultural_significance: Center of human civilization and political power
locations.visual_references: Medieval Europe, Game of Thrones aesthetics
locations.lighting_notes: Golden afternoon light in the heartlands, grey and moody at borders
locations.sound_notes: Church bells, market bustle, horse hooves on cobblestone

locations.name: Valenheart
locations.description: Capital city of the Central Kingdoms, built where the River Valen meets the sea. A city of three levels: the noble heights, the merchant quarters, and the infamous Undercity.
locations.atmosphere: Grand but decaying, political tension simmering
locations.history: Founded by King Valen I after the Sundering, built atop ancient ruins that became the Undercity.
locations.cultural_significance: Heart of human civilization, seat of royal power
locations.visual_references: King's Landing meets Venice. Grand but showing age. Canals in lower city.
locations.lighting_notes: Fog diffuses light, dramatic shadows in narrow streets
locations.sound_notes: Seagulls, harbor activity, distant bells, street vendors

locations.name: The Crimson Palace
locations.description: Seat of royal power, a sprawling complex of red stone towers and interconnected halls. Beautiful but fortress-like, with hidden passages and secret rooms accumulated over centuries.
locations.atmosphere: Opulent but oppressive, secrets in every shadow
locations.history: Built by King Valen I, expanded by each successor. Some wings haven't been entered in generations.
locations.cultural_significance: Symbol of royal authority, where the fate of the kingdom is decided
locations.visual_references: Red Keep meets Versailles. Imposing exterior, lavish interior.
locations.lighting_notes: Dramatic torchlight, stained glass colors, dark corners
locations.sound_notes: Echoing footsteps, whispered conversations, rustling tapestries

locations.name: The Undercity
locations.description: The sprawling underground network beneath Valenheart, built on ancient ruins. Home to the city's poorest, its criminals, and its secrets. A maze of tunnels, caverns, and forgotten temples.
locations.atmosphere: Dangerous, lawless, but with its own twisted honor
locations.climate: Cool and damp year-round, no natural light
locations.history: Originally the ruins of a pre-Sundering city. Colonized by those fleeing persecution above.
locations.cultural_significance: Counter-culture to the surface, where different rules apply
locations.visual_references: Dishonored's Dunwall slums meets Skyrim's Ratway. Firelight and shadows.
locations.sound_notes: Dripping water, distant echoes, muffled music from taverns

locations.name: Smuggler's Bay
locations.description: A lawless port city on the kingdom's edge, technically under royal authority but effectively ruled by merchant princes and pirate captains. Where anything can be bought for the right price.
locations.history: Founded as a naval outpost, corrupted by proximity to trade routes and distance from authority.
locations.cultural_significance: Gateway to the wider world, mixing pot of cultures
locations.visual_references: Tortuga meets Waterdeep's docks. Colorful but grimy. Ships everywhere.
locations.lighting_notes: Harsh tropical sun, dramatic storm lighting, lantern-lit nights
locations.sound_notes: Seagulls, waves, creaking ships, drunken singing, market haggling
